title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 24 April 2015 - XWiki
content: has quit 00:42  has quit 00:53  has quit 03:28  has quit 03:37  has joined #xwiki 05:23  has quit 05:42  has quit 06:01  has joined #xwiki 06:03  has quit 06:43  has joined #xwiki 07:41  has joined #xwiki 08:01  has joined #xwiki 08:04  has quit 08:08  has joined #xwiki 08:10  has quit 08:28  has joined #xwiki 08:54  has joined #xwiki 08:54  good morning 09:06  has joined #xwiki 09:12  has joined #xwiki 09:14  has joined #xwiki 09:23  has joined #xwiki 09:34  has joined #xwiki 09:56  has joined #xwiki 10:28  has quit 11:41  has joined #xwiki 11:54  has quit 12:09  has joined #xwiki 12:12  has quit 12:14  is now known as 12:37  has joined #xwiki 12:38  has quit 13:04  has joined #xwiki 13:19  has joined #xwiki 13:27  has quit 13:39  has joined #xwiki 13:44  has joined #xwiki 13:49  has joined #xwiki 14:02  has joined #xwiki 14:24  has joined #xwiki 14:32  has joined #xwiki 14:48  has joined #xwiki 14:48  has joined #xwiki 15:04  has joined #xwiki 15:10  has joined #xwiki 15:19  has joined #xwiki 15:21  has quit 15:51  has quit 15:57  has joined #xwiki 16:21  has joined #xwiki 16:25  has joined #xwiki 16:33  has quit 16:33  has quit 16:39  has joined #xwiki 17:06  has joined #xwiki 17:08  has quit 17:08  tmortagne: was this wanted to added this new property in that commit: xwiki.store.cache.pageexistcapacity ? 17:08  it seems a different issue than 12046 17:08  (improve performances of exist checks) 17:09  vmassol: you are looking at the 3 commits diff I think 17:09  and it's not a new property 17:09  oh ok that's the "add missing documentation" 17:09  it was just missing in the conf file as indicated by the commit message 17:09  got it 17:10  has joined #xwiki 17:21  Hi xwikiers, I have Font-Awesome as an Icon theme, configured in the Administration Panel (Look&Feel -> Presentation) 17:22  I should be able to use 17:22  right? 17:22  Because it doesn't display anything at the moment, and I don't really know where to look 17:22  has joined #xwiki 17:22  (note: this is a custom xwiki based on packager tool) 17:23  (I've added xwiki-platform-flamingo-theme and xwiki-platform-icon-fontawesome as dependencies in my build) 17:25  Any idea? 17:27  has left #xwiki 17:30  sorry no idea… and Guillaume is on holidays right now 17:30  he's back next week though :) 17:30  Looking into style.css that is loaded, it seems that there is a lot about Glyphicon but I didn't find anything about Font-Awesome 17:31  Could it be that I'm missing Less :-) 17:31  And then I fallback to a default icon 17:31  I'll look at this 17:31  vmassol: Yes, I know I'm asking this kind of question the bad day :-\ 17:31  woshilapin: you should use $services.icon 17:31  All of the icons are not mapped 17:31  glyphicon is used only in menus… comes from Bootstrap 17:32  has quit 17:32  Maybe I need to manually load Font-Awesome StyleSheetExtension if I want to go without $services.icon? 17:33  this is the mapping http://design.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Proposal/XWiki+Icon+Set 17:33  Yes, I'm aware about this mapping 17:33  And some of the icons I want to use are not in it 17:33  if you want to go without the $services.icon … than you are using FontAwesome .. as it is. it's documented on their website how to call them " 17:33  " 17:34  Yes, but the icon is not displayed if I do this 17:34  It's like Font-awesome stylesheet is not loaded 17:35  (I'm not even sure how to check that correctly unless looking into all the CSS that are loaded) 17:35  in the case the icons don't exist … and you know a mapping also for Silk, you create an issue on jira, like this http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11533 17:35  well … first I think you should see in EM… if the Icon Themes App is installed right 17:36  Aouch, I don't even have the EM installed with this custom build 17:37  I probably need to look the correct maven module for this extension 17:37  is it not this one xwiki-platform-icon-fontawesome 17:37  ? 17:37  http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Icon+Theme+Application 17:38  http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Font+Awesome+Icon+Theme 17:39  View Source on the second link is broken 17:39  But anyway, I think xwiki-platform-icon-fontawesome should be fine since one of the dependency is Icon Theme Application 17:40  fixed 17:40  Ah, too fast for me :-) 17:40  Thanks 17:40  np 17:41  OK, so given what you told me, I should have anything I need 17:41  I'll try to manually load the StyleSheetExtension at least to see if it works 17:41  in the worst case scenario you can also use http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Font+Awesome+Icon+Macro 17:42  Thanks for the info 17:43  or manually use the CDN http://fortawesome.github.io/Font-Awesome/get-started/ 17:43  np 17:47  Adding this seems to work 17:47  #set($discard = $xwiki.ssx.use('IconThemes.FontAwesome')) 17:50  Additionnal question, can I configure in my build (in some pom.xml) some values from WebPreferences (like Icon theme and Color Theme)? 17:51  the question is whether these properties can be configured in xwiki.properties I guess 17:51  If they can, then I already know how to do it but can I configure Color Theme and Icon Theme in xwiki.properties? 17:52 \* woshilapin is looking into xwiki.properties... 17:52  I don't know, to know you need to find the code 17:52  and if the code users a default ConfigurationSource then the answer will be yes 17:53  now everything is possible 17:53  you can modify WebPreferences from your build too 17:54  WebPreferences, it's an object, right? 17:54  it seems GD hasn't considered these as configuration which is bad 17:54  (bad design I mean) 17:55  Ah, XWiki.XWikiPreferences is an object 17:55  So with XAR plugin, I should be able to modify values during the build 17:55  I don't know the code but I see: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/vmassol/45129372dbe1ec793586/raw/8a5d680ef573b9259dd95fbe00c53104084cd853/gistfile1.txt 17:55  woshilapin: no 17:55  there's a plugin to make a change to a wiki page as part of hte build 17:56  xwiki-platform-tool-xmldoc-update-plugin 17:57  http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/XARPlugin 17:57  I see something about modifying XWiki.XWikiPreferences in this link 17:58  ah yes indeed I forgot that I did this too ;) 17:58  :-) 17:58  I'm awesome ;) 17:58  So, what's the best option then, since you know both solutions 17:58  XAR plugin 17:58  it's more recent 17:59  well 17:59  the purpose is different actually 17:59  XAR plugin is wen you're generating a XAR 17:59  OK, cool 17:59  but you'll need that anyway 17:59  idk if we do that here, that's what we do in our channels 18:00  Can I do that in the generation of the distribution (packager plugin)? 18:00  Ah no, wait, I know where I'll do it 18:00  Forget about it 18:17  has quit 18:21  However, I'm not sure I completely understand how to read it.  For example, line 173 (requirement 150), the column AG say "WP3-targeted" but in column AS, it says that this requirement is not targeted.  Since a comment from WP2 is needed in "Consensus" (column AX), I'm not sure what to comment, even more since this requirement looks clearly WP3 to me. 18:21  has quit 18:21  Oups, wrong chat 18:23  However, I'm not sure I completely understand the layout. For example, line 173 column AG says "WP3-targeted" but in column AS says not targeted. If you could clarify the meaning of "not targeted" in this context that would be great. 18:25  ok you can have your channel back now 18:27  has quit 18:38  has quit 18:51  has quit 18:55  has joined #xwiki 19:03  has joined #xwiki 19:15  has joined #xwiki 19:16  has quit 19:21  has quit 19:24  has joined #xwiki 19:28  has quit 19:30  has quit 19:43  has quit 19:53  has quit 19:56  has quit 21:16  has quit 21:21  has joined #xwiki 22:19  has quit 22:28  has quit 23:25  has joined #xwiki 23:54  has joined #xwiki
